dcterms:creator: K. Gandhi
G. Stojnic
B. M. Lake
M. R. Dillon
dcterms:description: The Baby Intuitions Benchmark (BIB) consists of 2D videos of an agent moving and interacting with different objects in a grid-world environment. It proposes five common-sense reasoning tasks derived from research on infant intuitive psychology, requiring an observer model to reason about agentsâ€™ goals, preferences, and actions by observing their behavior.
dcterms:title: Baby Intuitions Benchmark (BIB)

dcterms:creator: T. Shu
A. Bhandwaldar
C. Gan
K. Smith
S. Liu
D. Gutfreund
E. Spelke
J. Tenenbaum
T. Ullman
dcterms:description: AGENT is a benchmark designed for core psychological reasoning, focusing on whether models can predict that agents have object-based goals and act efficiently. It evaluates models' abilities to reason about multiple agents and their interactions.
dcterms:title: AGENT
